Generation III.Ruby: Using the spikes on its rear end, Wurmple peels the bark off trees and feeds on the sap that oozes out. This Pok é mon 's feet are tipped with suction pads that allow it to cling to glass without slipping.
Generation III.Sapphire: Wurmple is targeted by Swellow as prey. This Pok é mon will try to resist by pointing the spikes on its rear at the attacking predator. It will weaken the foe by leaking poison from the spikes.
Generation III.Emerald: It sticks to tree branches and eats leaves. The thread it spits from its mouth, which becomes gooey when it touches air, slows the movement of its foes.
Generation III.FireRed: It lives amidst tall grass and in forests. When attacked, it resists by pointing its venomous spikes at the foe.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It lives amidst tall grass and in forests. When attacked, it resists by pointing its venomous spikes at the foe.

Generation IV.Diamond: It loves to eat leaves. If it is attacked by a Starly , it will defend itself with its spiked rear.
Generation IV.Pearl: It spits a white silk that turns sticky when it contacts air. It is used to immobilize foes.
Generation IV.Platinum: Often targeted by bird Pokémon, it desperately resists by releasing poison from its tail spikes.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It lives among the tall grass and in forests. It repels attacks by raising up the spikes on its rear.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It lives among the tall grass and in forests. It repels attacks by raising up the spikes on its rear.

Generation V.Black: Often targeted by bird Pokémon, it desperately resists by releasing poison from its tail spikes.
Generation V.White: Often targeted by bird Pokémon, it desperately resists by releasing poison from its tail spikes.
Generation V.Black 2: Often targeted by bird Pokémon, it desperately resists by releasing poison from its tail spikes.
Generation V.White 2: Often targeted by bird Pokémon, it desperately resists by releasing poison from its tail spikes.

Generation VI.X: It loves to eat leaves. If it is attacked by a Starly, it will defend itself with its spiked rear.
Generation VI.Y: It lives among the tall grass and in forests. It repels attacks by raising up the spikes on its rear.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Using the spikes on its rear end, Wurmple peels the bark off trees and feeds on the sap that oozes out. This Pokémon's feet are tipped with suction pads that allow it to cling to glass without slipping.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Wurmple is targeted by Swellow as prey. This Pokémon will try to resist by pointing the spikes on its rear at the attacking predator. It will weaken the foe by leaking poison from the spikes.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It loves to eat leaves. If it is attacked by a Starly, it will defend itself with its spiked rear.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It spits a white silk thread that turns sticky when coming into contact with air. The silk is used to immobilize foes.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Likes sap and is abundant in the wild. Why it evolves into various different forms is unknown. One cannot tell from a Wurmple's appearance which form it will take when it evolves.
